Title: Paid Online English Tutor/Teacher - work from home anywhere in the UK!
TitleDescription: Are you an experienced tutor or teacher looking for more work? We are seeking qualified and experienced tutors to join our Writing Feedback team.
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

About the Role
The Writing Feedback Service is our asynchronous essay and writing review platform. Through this service, learners can submit documents for constructive feedback on their use of English, and their writing more generally. This platform is available 24/7, and we commit to review and return all files in 24 hours or less.

You will be able to review available submissions at any time of your own choosing, day or night, and from anywhere you have a stable internet connection. You can simply log in, browse the available submissions, and select one to begin. Each submission will have a fixed price based on your hourly rate. For example, a submission that is projected to take 60 minutes of active work will be priced at GBP £10.50; a submission that falls into the 30 minutes category will be priced at GBP £5.25.

This is our peak demand period so we need candidates that can start straight away and complete at least 10 hours’ worth of work per week. Above that requirement you can work as much as you would like as there will be significant student demand so there is great earning potential in this contract.


About Us
Studiosity, an Australian born Edutech company, is a world leader in the provision of 24/7 innovative online, on-demand study support to students right when they need it. Since 2004, we have delivered over one million web-based learning sessions to students located around the globe from high schools, colleges, universities and outreach educational facilities.

We offer flexible hours, comprehensive online training and ongoing professional development, and the opportunity to support students and provide impactful learning experiences.

 

Qualifications

To qualify, individuals MUST have the following:

  • Minimum of Bachelor's degree (Completed)
  • Reside in the UK
  • Strong English communication skills
  • High level of competence with computer and internet use
  • Reliable power supply
  • Reliable internet connection

 

If successful, you will be under United Kingdom’s law as a contractor at an all-inclusive rate of GBP £10.50 per hour on our Writing Feedback Service.

 

What we offer

  • A timely and frequent payment system direct to your bank account
  • Access to comprehensive online training and ongoing professional development resources
  • Ease of working from home at times that suit your lifestyle
  • Holistic support including a community of friendly peers
  • Modern, user friendly technology and tools
  • The opportunity to partner with top universities and schools to help student outcomes around the world

What we ask:

  • Bachelor degree or more
  • At least finished university degree
  • Live in the UK

Location: Anywhere in the UK

Apply

Title: Student Support (Nursing/Education) Paid Internship in Hampshire in Holybourne

Education and Care

Location:
Holybourne near Alton, Hampshire, UK.

It is a wonderful place that is located quite close to London, Brighton and other important cities (not possible to go and come back every day)

Classroom

We will provide training and this will provided and paid for by the organization.

Beginning September 2019 until end July 2020, 6 minimum - 11 months ideally.

The organization will assist with subsidized accommodation. Title: Conversation Assistant in Spain
TitleDescription:
Applications are now available for the program here in Spain starting in September 2019!
In your assigned Spanish school. The aim is that you aid in improving teaching and student communication in English for 25 classroom hours per week from Monday to Friday. Students could vary in age from infant to secondary depending on placement..
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

Is CAPS in Spain right for me?

The previous 1800+ Conversation Assistants who have completed the programme will all testify that CAPS is a life changing opportunity, and we are now looking for the new wave of people to add to the success story. If your New Year´s resolution is to make a big change in your life, and helping children in Spain improve their English seems like an ideal role and destination, then we want to hear from you!

Spain is a Mediterranean paradise because of its weather, socialising, culture and good health. Spain ranks as the best place in Europe for people moving abroad and wanting to enjoy life. Rather than living mostly in a tourist bubble, the CAPS Programme allows people to be fully immersed in the culture of Spain. Spaniards are a friendly bunch, making Spain one of the best places in the world to make friends. With a little effort with the local lingo, socialising is a breeze and friends are made for life.

What are the three Programs?

In CAPS there are three programs you can apply to.

  • CAPS – Provides the host family stay and does not require a high amount of experience (Ideal for those looking for the needed classroom experience)
  • CAPS PLUS - Provides the host family stay and does require a degree and experience
  • CAPS PLUS STAR – Is an independent living position which requires a degree and experience

What will I be doing?

General tasks include: Assisting in whole class alongside main teacher or individually with groups of students, helping with questions related to pronunciation and forming sentence structures, assisting with the preparation of classes or help to prepare complementary material/activities, for example dialogues, quizzes, reading exercises, games, audio-visual activities, presentations, preparing displays, helping with the preparation of oral exams, and speaking practice with teachers (helping the teachers of the school improve their oral English skills) or “speaking + reinforcing language structure with teachers (explaining areas of grammar and other complexities of the English language).

With your volunteer host family:  Usually each assistant lives with three host families (one per term). The families are connected to your assigned school and volunteer because they are really interested in learning about you, your culture and also a big positive is that you are a native Speaker and can help them (especially the children) improve their English skills. Therefore it is important to bear in mind that this family will want to spend time with you during the week and at weekends. This relationship is something that makes this programme really special, and in return for your time you will be integrated as another member of the family and this is the best way to fully immerse yourself in a new country.

Where will I be living?

With a volunteer host family full-board and the majority of positions are located within the regions of Catalonia, the Valencian Community and also other areas of Spain.

What other benefits are there?

  • Free Certified (6 ECTS credits*) TEFL or Advanced TEFL (Teaching English as a Foreign Language) training course, provided by an internationally recognised Spanish University.
  • Student Internship contract
  • Continuous support and feedback from the assigned tutor/mentor in the school and by the programme organisers.
  • CAPS PROGRAM - student grant of 315€ (after taxes) per month.
  • CAPS PLUS PROGRAM - student grant of 465€ (after taxes) per month.
  • CAPS PLUS STAR PROGRAM - student grant of 915€ (after taxes) per month.
  • Full-board accommodation with a volunteer host family (CAPS &CAPS PLUS)
  • Great international work experience to add to you CV and the chance to learn a new language!

What we offer

  • Great international work experience to add to you CV and the chance to learn a new language!
  • CAPS PLUS STAR PROGRAM - student grant of 915€ (after taxes) per month.
  • CAPS PLUS PROGRAM - student grant of 465€ (after taxes) per month.
  • CAPS PROGRAM - student grant of 315€ (after taxes) per month

What we ask:

  • At least finished college A levels
  • English to a native level with a good command of the language (the ability to speak Spanish is not required)
  • Completed Pre-University studies; A-levels, Highers or equivalent. Non EU Studies; High School Diploma. A current university student or graduate would be advantageous but all applicants will be assessed on their skills and most importantly character.
  • Aged between 20 and 30.
  • No prior criminal convictions.
  • Enthusiasm for working with children and encouraging them to speak in English.
  • An adaptable attitude and the ability to socialise and interact with people.
  • Desire to live in a foreign country and make the most of the experience.
  • Commitment to giving their all during the full programme.

Apply

GAC Hospitality Internship Program offers you the opportunities to see how law is done in other countries but also give you a new perspective on a wide range of issues. This is the chance to gain hands-on professional skills and experience, and stand out from your peers in the very competitive field of Law.
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

Law in China is currently undergoing gradual reform, as many elements inside and outside the country emphasize the need to strengthen the rule of law in China, especially regarding international trade. Globalization has spurred transformations in various areas of Chinese domestic law. GAC offers internships in the legal sector in some of most popular Chinese law firms, as well as some well-known multinational corporations. Interns will assist with insurance renewals, insurance and other claims, insurance certificates, document organization and related administrative functions. Other tasks include assisting with contract analysis, company correspondence and communications.

Our prices start from US$1,980, depending on your service components, accommodation and length of stay.

Right now, we have a special offer: 5% discount or up to US$2000 scholarships are available to you before May 31.

What we offer

  • Guaranteed Paid Intern Placement
  • Chinese Language Curriculum
  • Housing Accommodation

  • Pre Arrival Support&Assistance
  • Welcome Pack & Orientation
  • 24/7 Onsite assistance
  • Visa Support
  • Activities & Tours
  • Business Networking Events
  • Join our Alumni
  • Certificate & Credits

What we ask:

  • At least finished high school
  • 18 years old or over
  • Willing to travel and live abroad for a period of time
  • Independent and self sufficient
  • Focused and driven to succeed

Title: Discover Europe for free – Become a Mentor for Language Learners
TitleDescription: Volunteer abroad as a Mentor for Language Learners and have your board and lodging in beautiful hotels covered. Visit Malta, Prague, Budapest, Dublin, Krakow and many more this summer. Optionally, become a qualified TEFL teacher in weeks using an AngloTEFL Scholarship! The Angloville Programme was featured in: Lonely Planet, Forbes, Fashion Magazine, Travel Magazine, Glasgow Guardian
JobCategory: Summer / Holiday Jobs, Internships, Temporary Full Time, Voluntary
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

As an English speaker, you stay in one of our beautiful venues in Malta, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Ireland or England for 1 to 8 weeks and help European students improve their English through a series of conversations and fun-packed activities. You are not a formal teacher, you are a partner for conversation while having a multicultural experience.

All board and lodging is paid for by Angloville, all you have to do is show up and talk in your native language! Not only will this look great on your CV, it is a great chance to explore another country, become more well travelled, meet great new friends, and of course having fun all the while!

What we offer

  • Free accommodation in beautiful venues across Europe
  • Full board during your stay - great local food.
  • Free city tours in multiple cities: Prague, Budapest, Dublin, Krakow, La Valetta, and more
  • An accredited TEFL-qualification (optional with 3 week long programmes)
  • Meet new friends - an opportunity to connect with people from 20+ countries
  • Build your CV
  • Become more well travelled
  • Have loads of fun!

What we ask:

  • At least finished high school - high school GCSE's
  • No previous work experience required
  • Be a Native English Speaker / Native level of English
  • 18 year old +
  • Active participation in all fun-packed activities and conversations during the week.
  • Conversing in English, not teaching. That's it!

Participation fee: 0 GBP. Exchange program is free for English-speaking volunteers to attend. Join more than 8000 people from all over the world for an Angloville experience this year.

Pick an amazing picturesque venue for yourself, and apply now!

Apply

Title: Digital Marketing Internship
TitleDescription: We are an online retailer and wholesaler focusing on health, beauty, cosmetics and personal care. We go to great lengths to identify products and services that will enrich people's lives and well being and then serve these via fully responsive websites across EU markets in a way that is secure, easy to use, convenient and localized. Established back in 2005, we have become one of Europe's biggest online well-being retailers and have done this by offering World class customer service and delivering an unrivaled overall shopping experience.
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

Are you an undergraduate searching for an internship? This experience is designed to give you the skills you need to succeed in e-commerce. The training you receive will start with an introduction to the technical and soft skills you will need to make an impact, and will continue as you work on live projects, learning first hand how we deliver for our customers. Your responsibilities will be to:

  • Ensure fresh, new and relevant content is added across all our UK brands
  • Create written and visual content
  • Produce marketing material- posters, leaflets, and newsletters
  • Get involved with our social media platforms
  • Plan and organise relevant marketing campaigns
  • Promote new features and engage with existing customers
  • Gain exposure to our email marketing activities
  • Become an expert in Google Analytics and Google Adwords
  • Keep up to date with the companies SEO activities

What we offer

  • UK office is only a short walk away from East Croydon station, which has excellent train links to Central London, allowing access to the city in just 25 minutes.
  • Facilities boast a modern work environment and play area. Whether you are into gaming, pool, table tennis, football or simply socialising, we would love for you to come and join our very unique atmosphere.
  • We encourage team collaboration and provide excellent meeting facilities, with the latest technology and practices. We believe that if you create work environments that allow people to feel inspired, it will attract better people and bring success.

What we ask:

  • You should be registered as a university student
  • Experience is a bonus, but more important is in interest in the digital marketing industry
  • An understanding of the digital marketing industry
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Strong time management and organisational skills
  • The ability to understand customers and their online needs
  • Able to work deadlines whilst under pressure

The Company

Established a little over twelve years ago, we have organically grown from a start up to a multinational company, with offices in 3 continents and covering 13 markets, globally. We have done this by creating world-class e-commerce brands and achieving year on year growth. Based in East Croydon, we are part of a group that has great financial stability and we are continuing our year on year growth plan.

Who We Want

  • We want original, collaborative and passionate people who are open to new ideas, eager to learn, with a love of solving problems.
  • We're looking to appoint a bright, enthusiastic intern to help us deliver on our ambitions, who is ready to put their skills to the test to prove themselves in an e-commerce environment and is searching for greater responsibility and rewards.
  • We're a sociable bunch who drive to succeed, taking pride in everything we do and celebrate our accomplishments along the way.
  • If you believe that you have a strong work ethic, intelligence and a 'can do' attitude, we would love to hear from you. Please send us your CV and a brief cover letter demonstrating how you meet the criteria for this opportunity.

Apply

Are you the perfect candidate? Click the button 'apply now' and we'll contact you as soon as possible!

Title: Keycafe is hiring a handyman
TitleDescription:
Are you:
- Accountable and reliable with freelance work?
- Flexible with your schedule?
- In possession of a smart phone with mobile data to chat on the go?

Do you:
- Have mounting and installation equipment?
- Live in the Downtown London Area?

If you answered yes to all of these questions then you just may be the perfect fit for this role!
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

Mounting and Installations:

We need a handyman with all their own tools to step up to the plate and install new systems within the London area. Our boxes are mounted on various types of walls such as wood, drywall, concrete, tile, etc. This person should be able to handle drilling into and securely installing our systems into these mediums without hesitation. At times these may also need to be uninstalled or relocated so being able to patch up drywall and other materials is a plus!

General Tasks:

We'll also need to be able to count on you to go to one of our many smartbox locations in London to check out any technical issues. This can range from a system being unplugged, to refilling the inventory, and even replacing/repairing parts for the system. In any case, our customer support team will always be online to assist you through these tasks.

Site Surveys:

Another small part of this position is surveying potential new locations in the area as we grow. For this, you will represent Keycafe as we will send you to meet with the owner/manager of these stores. Being able to follow precise directions and being highly responsive on the go is essential. Having a smart phone capable of uploading photos from anywhere into our chat system is also critical for success. You will need to have a good eye for finding optimal spots to install our system that are easy to locate for our customers but not in the way of the business.

What we offer

  • diversity
  • Flexibility
  • online
  • part time work
  • second source of income

What we ask:

  • Teamwork
  • Problem solving
  • Communication
  • 0 to 6 months
  • No certificate required

Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter including:

- Your name/nickname

- Primary method of transportation around the city

- A short paragraph about yourself

Title: Work from home data capturer  in Brigstock
TitleDescription: To research and complete company records on a data spreadsheet. Work from home. Pay per record competed!
JobCategory: Casual / Part Time Jobs, Summer / Holiday Jobs
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

Data Capturers will work independently on a temporary basis. They will be provided with a spreadsheet with a list of minimal data, they are required to fill in the blanks by searching for the information online.

The information provided will be a name/company name and a partial postcode.

The information that must be sourced based on the information provided is:

  1. Contact Number – Essential
  2. Contact Name
  3. Contact Address – Essential
  4. Contact Email address
  5. Company Email address
  6. Website
  7. Business details i.e. type of farm

 

Data Capturers will be paid per record completed and this must include the ‘essential’ requirements to qualify as a completed record.

 

Place of work: Anywhere, we have desk space available at the office if a capturer would like to use that otherwise we are happy for the work to be completed externally.

 

Hours of work: this can be carried out at anytime as often as the capturer would like

 

Our Goal:

As a business we would like to have 5,000 records completed by September 2019. We do not expect this to be completed by only one person therefore we are looking for several capturers to complete this.

 

Payment:

Payment rate is £0.70p per record

Each capturer will be required to submit their completed data once a week, payment will be made every Friday for the work carried out. Payment will be made via bank transfer.

 

Essential

You must have access to a computer/laptop and the internet to carry out this job.

What we offer

  • 0.70p per record
  • Flexible hours
  • Work from Home

What we ask:

  • Independent working
  • Microsoft Excel
  • Research
  • No experience required
  • No certificate required

About Cubitz:

Cubitz is a start-up that helps small-business owners by providing visibility on their businesses. We aggregate data across sales and marketing platforms to provide a simple view for business owners. We are looking for a developer to create and extend the functionality of our iOS app.

Cubitz is a true start up (only two people so far), so there is a range of ways to get involved. The position is unpaid but  we provide free lunch and travel costs.  Also, free access to gym with pool.

Work location is flexible. You will have access to a business suite in Waterloo (London) but you work can where you prefer.

Title: Paid research participant with dyslexia (£20 Amazon voucher) in London
TitleDescription:
Persons with dyslexia wanted!

You will be asked to complete a series of simple verbal and non-verbal cognitive tasks. 

Duration: approx 2 hours.
JobCompany: Cognitive processes in adults with dyslexia (a paid psychology research study)
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

Persons with dyslexia wanted!

You will be asked to complete a series of simple verbal and non-verbal cognitive tasks.

This is a temporary opportunity requiring just one 2-hour visit to a psychology lab.

You will receive a £20 Amazon voucher for your time.

What we offer

  • Experience of participation in a research study
  • You will also be contributing to further understanding of dyslexia and how it affects people.
  • £20 Amazon voucher for 2 hours of your time

What we ask:

  • Native English speaker
  • No experience required
  • No certificate required
  • No minimum education required

Eligibility criteria:

  • You MUST be a native English speaker i.e. you were born in a majority native English-speaking country where you would have been exposed to the English language from birth
  • Age 18 - 40
  • You have dyslexia

This study is being conducted by psychology PhD student Ella-Joy. I am based at London South Bank University and Richmond University.

The purpose of this study is to compare the performance of people with dyslexia and people without dyslexia on computer and paper-based tasks relating to executive function. Executive function is a collection of inter-related cognitive and self-regulatory processes that are responsible for problem-solving and goal-directed behaviour. Testing will take place over two 45 minute sessions with a short break in between.

If you require glasses, then please wear your glasses (or contact lenses).

If you have dyslexia, then you will need to show proof of your dyslexia diagnosis by means of your official letter from an educational psychologist.

This study has been reviewed and approved by the School of Applied Sciences Research Ethics Committee at London South Bank University.

Title: Paid Monitoring and Evaluation Internship in London
TitleDescription: Every year FoodCycle conducts a Monitoring and Evaluation Survey. These surveys ask questions from our volunteers, Project Leaders and Guests. They are essential in helping us understand how we fulfil the need in the local community, and we use this work to help inform our strategy and fulfil fundraising requirements.
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

ABOUT FOODCYCLE

FoodCycle is an award-winning national charity delivering volunteer-powered community Projects across England. We build communities in our Projects by combining surplus food, volunteers and spare kitchen space to create nutritious, three-course meals for the community. We currently have 37 Projects and open our doors every week to 1500 people.

We have 4 main aims:

  • To strengthen communities
  • To encourage friendships
  • To improve nutrition and reduce hunger
  • To change attitudes towards food and to reduce food waste


ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Transcribing: taking important qualitative data and presenting this in an easy to use/read format
  • Grouping and Analysing Data: You will help build a picture of our guests and their challenges through this work
  • Collating and Organising: You will enable us to understand each Project more deeply by collating all quantitative data and providing a summary of this work
  • Data Partners: You will work with our scanning partner to ensure all data is scanned correctly by Project
  • Data Presentation: The Project will culminate in presenting back all the data for each Project and for FoodCycle overall, to be used in our Social Impact Report, other external sources, funding reports and to volunteers to thank them for all their hard work.

What we offer

  • The chance to work with an award winning national charity
  • A fun and flexible working environment

About Us:

Hoppin Rabbit is the UKs first distributor dedicated to bringing the UK, Independent French Craft Beer. We are a small family run business which we first established a year ago as a couple of craft beer lovers looking to do something we loved and have a real passion for. 

We have spent the last year building close relationships with all our brewers as well as dedicating our time to creating events like ‘tap take overs’ and ‘meet the brewer’ events around London to introduce French craft beer to the scene. One of our core fundamental values is to ensure our beer is delivered fresh as possible to our clients. So we are proud to transport the beer from the brewers in France to London via chilled temperature controlled trucks and then stored in our chilled storage units.

Quiz hosting is great fun and benefits from the extra cash for doing something that's very enjoyable. We attract a range of people from actors to accountants to magicians or stand-up comedians and teachers through to Countdown champions. The rewards are attractive too and work out at roughly £16 to £20 per hour as we offer a minimum of £40 per quiz, which rises with the size of the turnout with the only maximum being the capacity of the venue. Many quiz hosts at busy venues are achieving over £50 + per quiz. ABOUT CLUB FREELANCE

Club Freelance is a young, fast-growing company, with offices in London, Paris, Barcelona and Tunis. Our core business is to select the tech experts that best match our clients’ needs. Title: Stategy and Business Development Intern
TitleDescription:
This role will include a combination of strategy, business development, marketing and product related activities, with the key objective being to grow our relationships with prospective partners.
On a day-to-day basis, the focus may shift depending upon new opportunities and initiatives that arise.
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

itcher is the entertainment discovery app that solves the problem; What to do next in your free time? Free time is very valuable and what would be worse than to get poor recommendations for the limited free time we have. itcher generates recommendations for movies, TV shows, books, music and games personalized to each user’s taste.
Additionally, itcher is the first product in the world that can “save marriages”.
It can solve the Friday night problem, when a couple is sitting on the sofa trying to agree upon which movie to watch together!

Role and Responsibilities:

Business Development

  • Identify and contact prospective B2B partners:
  • Identify and contact prospective B2C partners
  • Manage and maintain communications in HubSpot with both prospective partners and those with whom we are actively in discussions
  • Keep HubSpot current and up to date with all BD activities
  • Monitor and communicate competitor activity
  • Seek out and be aware of how and where the latest digital innovations could apply to itcher

Marketing

  • Draft, produce and distribute (through Mailchimp) the itcher Newsletter on a bi-weekly, or weekly basis (as per requested by the management)
  • Develop a push notification strategy, including automatic triggers to optimize engagement with existing users
  • Draft, publish and distribute relevant content articles on the itcher Magazine, as well as across all itcher marketing channels
  • Manage all itcher social media channels including Facebook and Twitter, activity frequency: one update per week per platform.
  • Vlogging – 3-4 videos per week
  • Forum posts about itcher’s product, problems it solves; one per day on average

PR (B2B/B2C)

  • Lead outreach to journalists and “influencers” to educate on itcher, and the overall proposition (e.g. solvinga ubiquitous problem in the market)
  • Announce Couple Recommendations and other new features to our user base, as well as to the press as relevant

Product

  • All digital products, apps, etc need to constantly improve their engagement and retention. This is one part of the intership Identify potential partners who could be interested in leveraging itcher’s Voice UI platform for content discovery
  • Review if there could be an application for voice within an inflight entertainment environment (e.g. with a prospective relevant partner)
  • Evaluate current Voice UI product and compare against other similar products in the market (benchmarking).

Logistics and Administration:

  • Any ad hoc tasks that the management may have; preparation for meetings, conferences, preparing meeting minutes, bookings, etc.
  • All tasks shall be highlighted, prioritised and tracked in ToDoist on a daily basis
  • A weekly/daily report should be shared, highlighting the activities and accomplishments from the previous period
  • Most, sometimes all, work will be done remotely. Work may be completed at Google Campus London or in Dubai

What we offer

  • .
  • .
  • .

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required
  • Must haves: energetic, hands-on-attitude and keen interest to drive results
  • Passion for digital and Internet businesses with a sparkling positive attitude
  • Strong initiative to drive tasks over the “finishing line” without supervision
  • Experience in similar roles will be of advantage
  • Ability to understand business and technical concepts (often common sense) and to make good business decisions
  • Passionate focus on customers and their requirements
  • Strong analytical skills; ability to summarise findings and make recommendations based on numbers
  • Excellent communication skills, fluency in English (written and spoken). Additional languages are a plus.
  • Creative and innovative thinker, with a sales-driven approach

Title: Holiday Assistant
TitleDescription: Perfect opportunity for any young person over the summer. This is in the Job section but it is so much more than a job. The trip has worked well for the past 20 years and we hope for an even better experience this year. Jim McIntyre is Nottingham's answer to Alan Sugar, you will be assisting him on a trip to France whilst on the way working on boats, houses and vehicles. The trip usually lasts between 2-8 weeks and the duration is purely flexible. Once in a lifetime opportunity for any young person looking for a paid holiday whilst learning new things on the way. Previous trips have been taken by French students and business students but it will be ideal for any young person who wants to explore the world as you will have plenty of free time along the way.
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

Holiday work in France perfect for students over the holidays, I have this advertisement in the "Jobs" section as you do get paid well, but people do this for the experience. I am a semi-retired Businessman, never married so no kids to share my holiday trips with, so for the past 20 years I have been employing young people anyone not too happy in their present job that are keen to try something new.

This is a fantastic opportunity for students, gap year, graduate still looking for that "proper job", students studying a foreign language, or young people with an interest in travel. This trip can also suit someone in employment that has some holiday entitlement to use up - I can do trips in 2 weeks, basically I can go several times a year between April and October, whenever I have a suitable companion. My hobbies and Business are inseparable: Building work, cars, boats and I work with a range of tradespeople in Nottingham. I have two French houses and boats in Brittany and St Tropez. I am best known as designer and manufacturer of sports cars (Google "Spartan Cars")and I have 3 of my own as well as Porsche and Jaguar, France trips usually use big Nissan Patrol and a trailer loaded with building materials for the two house renovation projects plus mechanics tools as I cannot resist disappearing in the engine room on my boat (Google Trader 47). Luckily you have your own en suite cabin "Boat is gorgeous" said Lizzie who did two trips.

The role includes shopping, cleaning, cooking and general maintenance duties. You will have free time to spend at the beach or around town. Travel is paid in full to include travel car journey down to France, in farmhouse, B and B's Flying home is an option on the arranged availability/date. On the journey down we stay at my two house renovation projects and we will do some work there with general duties, before heading off to one of the boats.

The Journeys end is near St Tropez where I rent a mobile home (Google "Parc St James" and/or "Direct Holiday Homes 5144B" to see actual one we rented last year). If your application is successful, we will arrange for you to speak to someone who knows me as a reference or someone that has been on the trip previously. Lauren, Lizzie, Claire all did the trip twice, Joanne and Jenny both came again (unpaid) as guests.

The next stage is to have a conversation, after this we arrange to meet in person with you. You may work for a few days in one of my Nottingham businesses to see if you get on with me and my family before going on the trip. I never hire anyone I have not met, and you would be most unwise to work abroad without meeting the employer. Interviews at my nephews business, Photo Nottingham which is a 15 minute walk from bus/tram stations, just a short walk from Victoria shopping centre underground car park.

Anyone living within 50 miles is free to attend an interview by appointment which can be evenings or a Saturday/Sunday, but if you are more than that distance you must phone for a good chat to assure that you are a top candidate.

The ideal candidate: physically fit, not necessarily a sports star but if I say "Run back I left my camera in that Café" I mean run.

Above average education, doesn't matter what subjects, and family background in business or the professions so that you have seen people climb life's ladder (even if you have slithered down a rung or two) and thus you intend to do the same.

We never go on this trip until you have completed a day or two working for me and have met several family members. We also never go until you have had a good chat with someone who has previously done the trip.

What we offer

  • Free time
  • Agreed pay amount
  • Buisness experience
  • All expenses paid

What we ask:

  • At least finished high school
  • Good talker
  • Good listener
  • Reliable
  • Handy
  • Fun

If you would like any more information a full document will be sent to you upon application, once you have decided if the trip will be right for you we candiscuss an ideal time for an interview.

Apply

If your are interested in joing me on this once in a lifetime opportunity there is no harm in applying. If you would like to know more just ring me on 07976 756402 and I will asnwer any questions.

Title: Health and Care paid internship in London
TitleDescription: Hello, we’re Kaleidoscope. A social enterprise using our earnings to further our mission: to work with others in health and care to create a future which is connected, kind and joyful.
JobCategory: Full Time Jobs, Temporary Full Time, Placements
JobDescription:
What are you going to do

We're very excited to be launching The Perspectives Programme, a 9 month internship placement for people at the start of their career in the health world. We're looking for two interns to join our team.

The programme is designed to discover new and creative ways to tackle how to promote unheard voices in the context of health and care.

Although we are big fans of a cup of tea at Kaleidoscope, we don't want interns who are glorified tea makers (although in fairness, cups of tea are probably a key part of all of our roles).

This internship is about making a real difference, so alongside supporting client delivery, interns will be supported to design and lead on their own project to improve the way unheard voices are heard in healthcare.

The programme is open to all applicants, no matter their background or experience provided they have a passion for improving health and care, and a plan for promoting unheard voices and celebrating diversity.

For the first round of recruitment we just want to know about a project that candidates think we should invest in.  We want you to reflect on your experience or that of family or friends, and pitch us a project (which will take approx 1 day per week over 9 months to deliver) that promotes a way in which health and healthcare can hear from unheard voices. We've done lots of different and wonderful stuff so anything is possible (well, almost!) as long as it addresses the way unheard voices are heard in health care.

For the duration of the internship we will support you to spend approximately 20% of your time (1 day a week over a 9 month period) developing and delivering a project to promote unheard voices in healthcare. What this project will look like is up to you - telling the stories of a marginalised group, a project to hear lived experiences in policymaking, or something completely different!

But (and this is important) as well as offering you a chance to design and deliver your own programme we will also give you real experience of consultancy and the health and policy sector.  From the outset we will expect you to work as part of Kaleidoscope supporting client delivery and leading pieces of your own work - all done with the overt aim of building your skills and confidence in the workplace.

We do "traditional consultancy" through advising health and care organisations on their strategy, we support networks and partnerships, we design and facilitate a whole host of face-to-face and digital events and we work with clients across the public, private and voluntary sectors. But we also like to play with ideas that help our mission, even if it costs us money to do it.  We're going to keep thinking up new ideas and seeing which work wonderfully, which flop fantastically, and which should never be touched by anyone, ever again.

We're proud of what we're doing at Kaleidoscope, and we want to share this with as many people as possible. Diversity of thought and experience is incredibly important and if we want to continue to grow as an organisation that produces fresh and creative ideas, we need to support a variety of voices and perspectives to be a part of Kaleidoscope.

We are not able to sponsor any visas at this point, so all applicants must be eligible to work in the UK and over 18 years of age.

What we offer

  • Real work experience as part of a programme team delivering client contracts
  • 9 month placement paid at London Living Wage
  • Opportunity to deliver your own project from design to implementation
  • Flexible working with options to work from home/remote work
  • Exposure to a diverse range of events in health, social care & policy
  • A mentor
  • Optional short placements
  • Visits within our network of organisations and partners
  • Free lunches every day
  • Table tennis matches on the office balcony

What we ask:

  • No minimum education required but candidates must be literate, numerate and comfortable using a computer to produce documents
  • We don’t want this to be an internship advertised for ‘early career starters’ where you also need a Masters degree, 3 years of work experience and a knighthood to apply. Because to be honest, in most cases it’s probably not necessary.
  • Committed to diversity. Able to draw on personal lived experience to promote diversity in health and/or at Kaleidoscope
  • A passion for improving health and care, who wants to promote unheard voices and celebrate diversity
  • A keen interest in the health and care world. No formal expertise required - just lots of enthusiasm and interest in our work
  • Organisational brilliance. From experience of running projects to organising a huge birthday bash for your Mum's fiftieth; we're looking for someone who can juggle a lot while having an eye for detail.
  • A flexible and proactive attitude. Thumb twiddlers need not apply. And while office yoga is not (yet) mandatory, you will have to be happy taking responsibility for a range of different tasks with an ability to adapt quickly.
  • Tech savvy. You don't need to be a complete IT whizz, but a bit of tech skill combined with creativity won't go amiss.
  • Resilience. Kaleidoscope is no fairy-tale; and as a start-up without a genie propping us up with stacks of gold, we've no right to exist. Tolerance of ambiguity is key here.
  • A bucket load of charm. You know how to talk to all-sorts, and like doing so too. You'll also understand what it takes to work well in a team (please note, we accept gifts of biscuits all days of the week but prefer cake on Fridays).

Application Process

Round one: Project Pitch (closing date: 9am Monday 24th June 2019)

As part of the Perspectives Programme we will support you to spend a day a week of your 9 month placement to develop and deliver a project which will improve how unheard voices are heard more clearly in the context of healthcare.

Reflecting on your experience or that of your family or friends, pitch us a project (which will take approx 1 day per week over 9 months to deliver) which promotes a way in which health and health care can hear from unheard voices.

We will assess your project proposal using 3 criteria;

  • Rationale for idea/imagination shown in the idea itself
  • Project approach (how you would do it)
  • Outcomes/creating change (what would change as a result?)

Please outline your proposal, of no more than 2 A4 pages and submit it as the "Motivation Letter" on your application. Only include your initials and mobile number as identifiers on the proposal (put these on both pages).

Have questions? Have a look at our website here or email us (with "Intern Application" as the subject) if you have specific queries we can help with.

Thank you! We hope to hear from you.

Apply

Are you the perfect candidate? Click the button 'apply now' and we'll contact you as soon as possible!

We are an English immersion course for Spanish students to practice English without having to travel abroad. Since July 2004 we have “taught” English to Spaniards and welcomed thousands of English-speaking teenagers to our little villages, where the official language is no longer Spanish.

Title: Brand Ambassador for Scrumbles Pet Food! in London
TitleDescription: Fancy getting paid to post funny cat clips and cuddle puppies across the country? Do you dream in likes and retweets? Is your phone full of funny animal videos? What are you going to do

Why work for Scrumbles

Scrumbles is a fast-growing pet food start-up that is disrupting the market. We make natural, ethical cat and dog
food filling a gap in the market for a high quality, responsibly sourced pet food that's accessible. Despite an
increased understanding of animal nutrition, cats and dogs have never been as unhealthy and with lots of mixed
messages, pet parents are a little confused – we're here to sort it.

We keep it real and don't follow fads. We're not afraid to stand up and speak the truth and like to do things a little
differently. As a dynamic challenger brand making waves in the industry it couldn't be a more exciting time to join
us and help break the mould.

We believe that businesses can (and should) help change the world for the better. You'll be a part of a unique

around us.

  • Continually test and learn to ensure we're doing the things that matter
  • Build and manage our influencer community

  • Support on innovation design, development and launch
  • Stay true to the Scrumbles brand across all online touchpoints to maintain the Scrumbles brand image with a consistent look, feel and TOV
  • Keep close to analytics to improve our performance to reduce our CPA
  • Monitor social media conversations. You will be our ear to the ground.

What we offer

  • Competitive salary
  • Daily cuddles with Scrumbles’ furrier members
  • Free food for your furry family
  • The opportunity to join a start-up early in its mission where you can make a real difference

What we ask:

  • Has an active, well-rounded personal presence in social media
  • Is a natural problem solver with an analytical mind
  • Enjoys the fast-paced nature of a start-up
  • A passion and hunger to make a big impact
  • Has an analytical mind
  • Is organised and calm under pressure with the ability to prioritise
